intro: Waltheria microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved waltheria, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in disturbed areas and along roadsides. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
